content.text: B.	Proposed post and non-post resource requirements for 2026

children.text: Overview
The proposed regular budget resources for 2026, including the breakdown of resource changes, as applicable, are reflected in tables 1.11 to 1.13.

Additional details on the distribution of the proposed resources for 2026 are reflected in tables 1.14 to 1.16 and figure 1.II.

As shown in tables 1.14 (1) and 1.15 (1), the overall resources proposed for 2026 amount to $7,725,500, reflecting no change compared with the approved budget for 2025. The proposed level of resources provides for the full, efficient and effective implementation of mandates.

Other assessed resources

As reflected in tables 1.14 (2) and 1.15 (2), other assessed resources amount to $938,600. The resources would complement regular budget resources and provide for the requirements indicated in the report of the Secretary-General on the budget for the support account for peacekeeping operations for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026 (A/79/783).
Information on the timely submission of documentation and advance booking for air travel is reflected in table 1.17.

The compliance rate for travel of the members of the Advisory Committee to their countries of origin is affected by national policies and route changes, which can impact advance travel planning undertaken by the secretariat of the Committee to make travel arrangements within the specified notice period. Despite a 23 per cent improvement in compliance compared with the 2023 budget period, delays in ticketing for the Committee’s annual field trip and complications in the onboarding of new members continued to affect the processing of travel arrangements. The Secretariat is keeping all relevant factors under review as it continues to optimize its support to the work of the Committee and in achieving the target compliance rate.
Compliance rate
(Percentage)
